pr_title: Extract Config into Deprecated and Non-Deprecated parts

timeline.message:
Extract Config into Deprecated and Non-Deprecated parts

This way the classes with config keys can stay long term while we move the config class out.

timeline.author: jpbempel

timeline.bodyText: I think we need to talk about formatting, because this isn't related to the change set and I doubt there is a Java code base where member fields assigned to within constructors are not prefixed with this. I would sort of get an argument that it's line noise, except a few lines up from here, a variable which is obviously not reassigned is prefixed with final. When I see final I'm scanning ahead looking for a closure.
timeline.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText:
Yes, I think now that we have more contributors, it might be worth revisiting.
I certainly have my opinions, but we should make a collective decision.
For me, I really dislike reassigning parameters -- final or not.
I'm also very much in favor of making most classes & methods final, but not so much local vars.
replies.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText:
private constructor?
I'd also prefer to see constant holders final.  Well, really almost all classes, but especially constant classes.
timeline.author: dougqh

timeline.bodyText: Must admit, I'm not fan of the long list of static import, but I know that's our current norm.
timeline.author: dougqh
